title: Japan vs Scotland, Rugby World Cup 2019 player ratings: Who punched above their weight and who wilted in Yokohama?
text:
Scotland have been knocked out of the World Cup after suffering a 28-21 defeat in Yokohama.

Winger Kenki Fukuoka produced two pieces of individual brilliance for Japan as the hosts advanced to the quarter-finals for the first time.

The win ensured Japan finished top of Pool A and will face Pool B runners-up South Africa in Tokyo next Sunday, with Ireland facing Pool B winners New Zealand on the same ground next Saturday.

Fukuoka scored tries either side of half-time as the tournament hosts were roared on by a sea of red and white jersey-wearing fans with a frenetic attacking game and ferocious defence.

Loosehead prop Keita Inagaki and Kotaro Matsushima also scored tries for the tournament hosts,...
description: Scotland have been knocked out of the World Cup after suffering a 28-21 defeat in Yokohama.
